hints.content: For $\dfrac36$ and $\dfrac12$ to be equivalent, they must be fractions of  the same size whole.
Which image shows $\dfrac36$ and $\dfrac12$ represented on the same size whole?

options.alt: A medium-sized hexagon is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A medium-sized hexagon is divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The hexagons are separated by an equal sign. !

A medium-sized hexagon is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A medium-sized hexagon is divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The hexagons are separated by an equal sign. !

choices.content: ![A medium-sized rectangle divided into six equal parts with three parts shaded. A smaller rectangle divided in 2 equal parts with 1 part shaded. The rectangles are separated by an equal sign.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e91b7e43a057b5d2e5337c131e8c0f6d505f4bc4)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5e92ce89307e4829e4f7a401dbcd4ec12a24625b)

![A medium-sized hexagon is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A medium-sized hexagon is divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The hexagons are separated by an equal sign.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cb8e7f75873b6d720437145a31161659d20f2bb3)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e9d34261ecb0bf5357afb5a5213fccaa896233d5)

![A small seven-sided polygon divided into six equal-sized parts. Three of the parts are shaded. A large seven-sided polygon divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The polygons are separated by an equal sign.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/125776eb809998ab6af46352a446168ea2d59842)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cf596180703c1eeae4966c9d332688ef683a1b73)
